model

Interface PCExpression

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Clause, Unifiable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractOperator, And, Arithmetic, Constant, Equal, Not, ReactiveRule, Rule, SimpleSentence, Variable

    public interface PCExpression
    This interface represents the predicate expressions.
    Author:
    Alexandre Camus

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      PCExpression replaceVariables(SubstitutionSet s)
      Replaces all the variables in the predicate expression according to the specified bindings.
      PCExpression standardizeVariablesApart(Hashtable<Variable,Variable> newVars)
      Standardizes the variables in order to be sure that there won't be any variable clashes.

    • Method Detail

      • replaceVariables

        PCExpression replaceVariables(SubstitutionSet s)
        Replaces all the variables in the predicate expression according to the specified bindings.

        This method is recursive over all PCExpression implementations.

        Parameters:
        s - the SubstitutionSet that contains the bindings of the variables so far.
        Returns:
        a PCExpression object representing the bound predicate expression.
        See Also:
        SubstitutionSet

      • standardizeVariablesApart

        PCExpression standardizeVariablesApart(Hashtable<Variable,Variable> newVars)
        Standardizes the variables in order to be sure that there won't be any variable clashes.

        This method is recursive over all PCExpression implementations.

        Parameters:
        newVars - is a parameter to save over the recursion all the variable replacements done so far.
        Returns:
        a PCExpression object representing the standardized predicate expression.
